channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Administration Division: Roof Replacements Scheduled for Summer Months
item.description: All members of the campus community should note that roof replacements are scheduled for the Materials Research Center (MRC), Empire State Hall (ESH), and the west wing of the Jonsson Rowland Science Center (JRSC). Construction will begin on Monday, June 17 and be completed by Friday, August 9, with tentative daily work hours set for 6:00AM to 2:30PM, Monday through Friday.
item.author: Community

item.title: HR Alerts Community to Impact of Upcoming Percipio Administrative Upgrade
item.description: Rensselaer’s Division of Human Resources wishes to alert the campus community that the Percipio online training platform will undergo administrative upgrades from June 10 through June 17, 2024. These upgrades will affect Percipio’s in-progress tracking feature, so any current, in-progress Compliance Module assignments should be completed by June 10; any Compliance Modules that are launched between June 10 and 17 must be completed in their entirety in a single session.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group to Hold Organizational Meeting
item.description: The Future of Computing Institute announces the formation of a Quantum Computing Users Group. On Wednesday, June 12, from noon to 2 pm, there will be an organizational meeting in CII 3116. The goals are to find out about the experience and background of interested parties, evaluate what more is needed to enable the campus QC to be used effectively and efficiently, and discuss other subjects the group may find interesting. RSVP to Tom Morgan.
item.author: Community

item.title: RCOS to Sponsor Soundscape Trail Orienteering Field Trip
item.description: Date: Thursday, June 27, 2024 9:30 AM - 3:30 PM - The Renssselaer Center for Open Source (RCOS) will sponsor a field trip to the Shaker Heritage Society site to see how Soundscape — one of RCOS’ active open-source projects — is being used to provide guided tours and athletic events for the visually impaired community. The event is open, but RCOS class members will be given preference; please register by June 13! Lunch will be provided.

item.title: CCPD, Sidewalk Warriors to Offer Civic Engagement Opportunity June 13
item.description: Beginning at 4:30PM on Thursday, June 13 at the United Methodist Church in downtown Troy, the Center for Career and Professional Development and participating students will be volunteering with Sidewalk Warriors, an organization dedicated to serving individuals in our community who are facing food insecurity, homelessness, and mental illness. Please come support those in need and help make a positive impact!

item.title: Registration Now Open for Capital Region Basketball Camp at RPI
item.description: Date: Friday, June 7, 2024 - Fri , August 2, 2024 (all day) - Registration is open for Capital Region Basketball Camp, a unique summer camp in which RPI Head Men’s Basketball Coach Mark Gilbride and his staff have designed programs to develop all facets of each camper’s game, as well as help increase their individual and team skills in an atmosphere that is challenging, competitive, and fun. Enjoy the convenience of dropping your child off at a sports camp right where you work!
